meanings.definition: The act of rendering or performing something, especially a piece of music or a dramatic role.
meanings.sent1: Her rendition of the song was beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The choir's rendition of the national anthem brought tears to the audience's eyes.
meanings.sent3: The rendition of the play had the audience laughing throughout.
meanings.sent4: His rendition of the character was so convincing, it felt like he was living in the role.
meanings.sent5: The rendition of the symphony was so powerful, it left a lasting impression on everyone.

meanings.definition: A version or interpretation of something, such as a song or a work of art.
meanings.sent1: This rendition of the painting captures the artist's vision perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The director's unique rendition of the classic play received rave reviews.
meanings.sent3: The quirky rendition of the sculpture added a fun twist to the exhibit.
meanings.sent4: Her rendition of the poem breathed new life into the words.
meanings.sent5: The artist's rendition of the landscape was so vivid, it felt like stepping into a dream.

meanings.definition: The act of delivering or handing over someone or something, especially to authorities.
meanings.sent1: The police requested the rendition of the suspect to the station.
meanings.sent2: The rendition of the package to the recipient was done with care.
meanings.sent3: The rendition of the lost wallet to its owner brought a smile to their face.
meanings.sent4: The rendition of the documents to the court was a crucial step in the legal process.
meanings.sent5: The rendition of the keys to the new owner marked the beginning of a new chapter.
